title: Periodic Table of Mobility: A policy guidance tool by NUMO

description.part2: Switch language between English and Spanish using buttons above.

resultPage.part2: Please choose from the drop-down menu at the bottom

resultOptions.flextext: Vehicles in this zone are allowed only when below 30 km/h and with an explicit function of pick-up and drop-off

document.driversReq: Driver license is required for this vehicle, more information can be found in this link
document.driversNotReq: Driver license is not required to operate this vehicle
document.operatingReq: Operating license is required for this vehicle, more information can be found in this link
document.operatingNotReq: Driver license is not required to operate this vehicle
document.dataLoose: A moderate amount of data is needed to be provided for this vehicle
document.dataStrict: A great amount of data is needed to be provided for this vehicle
document.dataNone: No data is needed to be gathered for this vehicle
document.pricesLow: This vehicle should have low fees and fines attached to it in legislation
document.pricesHigh: This vehicle should have high fees and fines attached to it in legislation
document.pricesNA: This vehicle should have no fees and fines attached to it in legislation
document.subsidyGiven: This vehicle should have its use incentiviced
document.subsidyNone: This vehicle should not have subsidies
document.riskReq: Risk assessment is required for this vehicle
document.riskNotReq: Risk assessment is required for this vehicle

inputPanel.part2: Please choose from the drop-down menu at the bottom or input specific vehicle attributes.

inputHelp.noDescription: No information is available for this attribute.
inputHelp.noteText: The thresholds used for this attribute are based on literature and expert feedback collected by NUMO. A future version of this platform will include the ability to adjust these thresholds.

summary.harmfulSum: This vehicle may be very harmful
summary.harmful: Policies should be aimed at reducing its overall risk. Consider allocating less space for them while giving preference to others, requiring more data from operators, requiring a license to operate, or charging high fees to operate.
summary.lessHarmful: Policies should be aimed at reducing its overall risk. Consider allocating less space for them, requesting some data from operators, or charging some fees to operate.
summary.notHarmfulSum: This vehicle is not likely to be harmful
summary.notHarmful: Policies should be aimed at promoting its use. Consider allocating more space to them, don’t request too much data from operators, don’t require a license to operate, and consider subsidizing their usage.

city.title: Please describe your social and policy priorities
city.subtitle: Learning about social and policy goals and priorities of a city is helpful to provide well-adjusted recommendations on transport policies
city.defgoals: Define your own goals and priorities (below)
city.placeholder2: Describe the priorities of your city in terms of the main policies you have at the national, local level and specific policies for transportation.
city.part1: Please rank the priorities for improvement according to current city policies (a higher number represents a higher priority):

attributes.part1: Please indicate what attributes you will use to define vehicles
attributes.part2: The attributes selected (with capacity, weight, speed, footprint, emissions and health being the default) will determine what attributes are required for your city

thresholds.name: Input city name
thresholds.title: Please determine the threshold levels for
thresholds.subtitle: Thresholds below determine the price assignation for use of a vehicle in your city

useCase.city: Chose the framework that you are going to use
useCase.title: Pleace indicate how you use the vehicle

header.title: Periodic Table of Mobility
header.subtitle: A policy guidance tool by NUMO
header.part1: This platform helps assess the impact of any vehicle (existing or hypothetical) depending on its attributes. There are pre-loaded values that you can choose to learn the policy implications of existing vehicles. You can add customized characteristics, or create new vehicle types as well.
header.link: Learn why this tool exists and how to offer feedback.
